name: Pecking Order
description: A vicious vessel is attacking Federation ships across the galaxy, leaving in its wake devastating damage and high casualties. Knock this nimble nemesis out of the stars.
rules:
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- In this Hybrid Event, you will complete Ship Battles in one Phase, and Supply Missions in another Phase.
-- Unique Ship Battles and Supply Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of J. Crusher, B. Crusher, Vadic, Tallinn, or crew from Star Trek: Picard will provide a bonus to Ship Battles and Supply Missions.
-- Using the Shrike, the La Sirena, or the Intrepid-class will provide a hull bonus in Skirmish Battles.
-- Community Rewards are also available during Phase 2!
-- Every Ship Battle or Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: J. Crusher, B. Crusher, Vadic, Tallinn, or PIC
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Missions!

featured_crew.name: Pallra
featured_crew.flavor: The widow of a husband with a dark past, Pallra tried to lure out his collaborators in order to blackmail them for money.

action.name: May I Be Honest With You?

featured_crew.name: Vadic
featured_crew.flavor: Hungry for revenge against the Federation for the torment they inflicted on her and the other Changelings, she helps a mysterious entity hunt for Jack Crusher.

action.name: How Very Precise With Your Timing

featured_crew.name: Tallin
featured_crew.flavor: As one of the mysterious Supervisors, Tallinn watched over and protected Renée Picard throughout the 21st century.

action.name: A Leap of Faith? It's Kind Of How I Roll

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

ship.flavor: Designed for long-term exploration. Able to land on the surface of a planet and powered by bio-neural gel packs.

rewards.name: Crusher
rewards.flavor: Without hesitation, Crusher opens fire on the masked bounty hunters that have infiltrated the SS Eleos XII to protect her son.

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: Skill
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Pallra
rewards.flavor: The widow of a husband with a dark past, Pallra tried to lure out his collaborators in order to blackmail them for money.

action.name: May I Be Honest With You?

rewards.name: Tallinn
rewards.flavor: As one of the mysterious Supervisors, Tallinn watched over and protected Renée Picard throughout the 21st century.

content.reroll_info:
Skirmish rewards are additive. By continuously rolling you receive additional rewards. No rewards are lost by rolling again.
DROP RATES:
Event VP: 13.58%
Time Portal Pack: 0.13%
Chronitons: 11.45%
Honor: 14.11%
Intel: 27.43%
Credits: 33.29%

adventures.name: Silenced Songs
adventures.description: Synthesize a gas to render the Shrike's crew unconscious.

adventures.name: Final Flight
adventures.description: Stop the Shrike once and for all!

rewards.name: Pecking Order
rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

rewards.name: Tallin
rewards.flavor: As one of the mysterious Supervisors, Tallinn watched over and protected Renée Picard throughout the 21st century.

action.name: A Leap of Faith? It's Kind Of How I Roll

rewards.name: Vadic
rewards.flavor: Hungry for revenge against the Federation for the torment they inflicted on her and the other Changelings, she helps a mysterious entity hunt for Jack Crusher.

action.name: How Very Precise With Your Timing

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

screens.text: "This is the Enterprise-D, requesting assistance. We've been repeatedly attacked by a mysterious vessel. No designation that we can find. It's small, but deadly. They are fully armed and many of their weapons are unlike anything we've ever seen."

"That sounds like it may be the same vessel attacking other Federation ships across the galaxy. Appearing almost out of thin air, launching a swift and often deadly attack, and then vanishing just as it came. Even I have been able to gather limited information on it."
"The 'often deadly' part does little to inspire any confidence. But if you can offer any help, we'd love to turn the tables on this insidious little pest!"

"The Federation. Like insects, all of you. I should have known that if I swatted one of you, two more would appear. That's all right. I'll reach your little hive before too long. Then annihilating the rest of you will be all too easy."
"What is it you want? Who do you work for? And why are you attacking Federation ships?"

responses.text: "You have grievances with the Federation? Surely there are better ways of addressing them."
"So you think you can take the Federation all by yourself?"
"What do you get out of all of this?"

screens.text: "You speak as if I'm the one who started this. No. Your Federation started this, when it took my brothers, sisters, and I and tormented us for its own selfish means. I serve only the interests of those of us so grievously wronged. And now, you all will reap what you have sown."
"Typical. And you don't think the Federation had better ways of handling their war with the Dominion? Was it necessary for them to do this to us? So they could use us against our own!?"
"I don't merely 'think' I can, Captain. Ask that Romulan there. The Shrike's record speaks for itself. I am only getting started."
"What do I get out of this? Why, revenge, Captain. Is there anything better?"
"This Changeling clearly has no further interest in discussion. Captain, don't let the Shrike escape! We need to find a way to put an end to its onslaught for good!"
